text: Honey bees make about 10 trips per day to gather nectar.
A cubic mile of seawater contains about 120 million tons of salt.
The world's largest snowflake on record measured 15 inches across.
A single lightning bolt can heat the air to 30,000 Kelvin.
The oldest known cave paintings are over 40,000 years old.
A queen termite can lay 30,000 eggs per day.
The world's deepest cave is Veryovkina Cave at 2,212 meters.
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
The world's highest waterfall is Angel Falls at 979 meters.
A dragonfly can fly in all six directions.
The world's largest iceberg was larger than the island of Jamaica.
A cricket hears through its knees.
The world's smallest mammal by mass is the Etruscan shrew.
A salmon can jump 12 feet into the air.
The world's largest spider by leg span is the giant huntsman spider.
A woodpecker can peck 20 times per second.
The world's fastest bird in level flight is the common swift.
A housefly lives for about 14 days.
The world's longest migration is by the Arctic tern.
A garden snail has about 14,000 teeth.
The world's largest fish is the whale shark.
A hippopotamus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.
The world's smallest octopus is the star-sucker pygmy octopus.
A polar bear's skin is actually black underneath its white fur.
The world's most poisonous frog is the golden poison frog.
A bat can eat up to 1,000 insects per hour.
The world's longest snake ever recorded was over 32 feet long.
A parrot can live for over 80 years.
The world's largest scorpion is the emperor scorpion.
A kangaroo can cover 25 feet in a single jump.
The world's heaviest bird capable of flight is the great bustard.
A penguin can drink salt water.
The world's largest jellyfish can have tentacles over 120 feet long.
A horse can sleep standing up.
The world's fastest diving bird is the peregrine falcon at 240 mph.
A spider can produce 7 types of silk.
The world's loudest insect is the cicada.
A leopard can carry prey twice its weight up a tree.
The world's largest ant colony spans 3,700 miles across Europe.
A seal can dive to 3,000 feet deep.
The world's smallest seahorse is smaller than a postage stamp.
A vulture can spot a 3-foot carcass from 4 miles away.
The world's largest amphibian is the Chinese giant salamander.
A cheetah can run up to 70 mph.
The world's most venomous fish is the stonefish.
A gorilla is about 10 times stronger than an adult human.
The world's largest crab is the Japanese spider crab.
A grizzly bear can run as fast as a horse.
The world's longest living insect is the queen termite at 50 years.
A flamingo can only eat with its head upside down.
The world's fastest snake is the black mamba at 12 mph.
A koala sleeps about 22 hours per day.
The world's largest moth has a wingspan of 12 inches.
A mouse's heart beats about 600 times per minute.
The world's deadliest spider by venom is the Sydney funnel-web.
A tiger's night vision is 6 times better than a human's.
The world's largest butterfly is the Queen Alexandra's birdwing.
A cow produces about 200,000 glasses of milk in its lifetime.
The world's largest living rodent is the capybara.
A rhinoceros can weigh up to 8,000 pounds.
The world's largest bat has a wingspan of 6 feet.
A hummingbird can remember every flower it has visited.
The world's largest leech can reach 18 inches long.
A cat has 230 bones while a human has 206.
The world's largest centipede can grow to 12 inches long.
A dolphin's brain is larger than a human brain.
The world's largest earthworm can grow to 22 feet long.
A peregrine falcon can dive at over 200 mph.
The world's largest snail is the African giant snail at 15 inches.
A mantis shrimp can punch faster than a bullet.
The world's largest turtle is the leatherback sea turtle.
A blue whale's tongue weighs as much as an elephant.
The world's largest frog is the Goliath frog at 3 feet long.
A great white shark can detect a single drop of blood from 3 miles away.
The world's largest lizard is the Komodo dragon at 10 feet long.
A golden eagle can spot a rabbit from 2 miles away.
The world's largest squid can grow to 43 feet long.
A killer whale can swim at 34 mph.
The world's largest clam can weigh over 500 pounds.
An elephant can smell water from 3 miles away.
The world's largest starfish can measure 3 feet across.
A sloth can turn its head 270 degrees.
The world's largest ray is the manta ray at 29 feet wide.
A giraffe's neck is too short to reach the ground.
The world's largest lobster on record weighed 44 pounds.
An ostrich eye is bigger than its brain.
The world's largest cuttlefish can grow to 20 inches long.
A hippo can open its mouth 180 degrees.
The world's largest sea urchin can grow to 14 inches across.
A chimpanzee is 7 times stronger than a human.
The world's largest prawn can grow to 18 inches long.
A gecko can run across water for a short distance.
The world's largest hermit crab can weigh up to 9 pounds.
A crow can remember a human face for years.
The world's largest sea anemone can grow to 6 feet across.
A housefly can taste with its feet.
The world's largest sponge can grow to 6 feet tall.
A bee's wings beat 200 times per second.
The world's largest barnacle can grow to 3 inches across.
An owl can rotate its head 270 degrees.
